Comments: I was sent the invoices I requested promptly. It is confusing when ordering since there are so many divisions of Scholastic.
I appreciate the quick reply when requesting invoices.
Have not yer spoken to anyone. I would like to place an order, however,
Submitting a request for a quote on line was convenient and response was fast.
I had to speak to multiple people to solve my problem and every time I call I get  different answer.

I am a retired elementary school librarian & also a librarian of Judaica. I wanted to know how many books S had about Judaism. Answer  - not very many. Experience good, but results not satisfactory. See previous comments

PO number 71553 was placed in Mid April and As of the May 15th we still had not received the order. I called and spoke with Abrianne Murphy and after research, she noticed that our order had been sitting in your warehouse for 2 weeks awaiting for us to set up transportation with DHL (which no one told us about nor have we ever had to do this)  I then requested that she just cancel the order because we do not have the time now to distribute the books to the students before school ends next week. Then all of the sudden, yesterday afternoon we received the order. We can not accept this order as we requested it to be cancelled and it has already been cancelled on our end. This is Federal money being used and we have certain guidelines to follow. Please make arrangements for this order to be picked up and returned. You are welcome to call me at 770-254-2800 Lisa Davis Coweta County Board of Education

I am trying to contact someone within Scholastic that I can share our brand new science comic book, with real experiments wrapped in a compelling story. Our company has been serving students in classrooms since 1992. We are a very credible company, that Scholastic is sure to want to do business with. No one has given me a name/contact information. When I call the operator quickly connects to someone who does not return a phone call.

I reached out to ask how to send our tax exempt certificate before placing an order. As the Bookkeeper for the school I deal with hundreds of vendors, so I was surprised that the agent advised you didn't accept tax exempt certificates to remove the tax. We would need to place the order, wait for an invoice, contact you again to have the tax removed, then wait for a new invoice to be sent. I asked why this process was necessary instead of doing like all of the other vendors we work with and just remove it from the beginning. She advised it was a Supreme Court ruling some time ago.

I reached out to ask how to send our tax exempt certificate before placing an order. As the Bookkeeper for the school I deal with hundreds of vendors, so I was surprised that the agent advised you didn't accept tax exempt certificates to remove the tax. We would need to place the order, wait for an invoice, contact you again to have the tax removed, then wait for a new invoice to be sent. I asked why this process was necessary instead of doing like all of the other vendors we work with and just remove it from the beginning. She advised it was a Supreme Court ruling some time ago.
I appreciate your continuous great customer service.
Nothing - very easy to work with!

Please let all students have access to all books.  I was disappointed to find out that you have no Christian books... Bibles, available to your Scholastic Book Clubs.  You sell a lot of other books, but I feel you are being very accepting of Christian views.  You sell magic books and that is a religion too.  My biggest question is would you please tell me why you don't sell these books?
I was able to get onto the site and view the items for purchase. They are much higher in price than in the scholastic school price.

Make it clear if bilingual books are presented in both English and Spanish. Different parts of the book's images and description were conflicting or unclear. The customer service representative told me she could not give me what I asked for, then proceeded to tell me how to get what I asked for.  She should have just done the latter.

I bought a couple books for my daughters birthday and a couple books for the teacher as a year end gift to stock her classroom. For whatever reason, and I was not notified of this, I never received the books. No one reached out to tell me that the plans had changed. I had to email on the last day of school and inquire. The response was that I was being refunded. I wanted these books. Why did you send out a flyer if you didn’t plan on fulfilling the orders? I understand there are unexpected situations, but I would have appreciated some communication. It makes me wonder if you would have kept the money if I never emailed you first. Sketchy customer service.

Maybe don’t cancel book orders?? I still don’t understand why our order was cancelled. I was looking forward to my oldest being able to read something this summer. I will not order through scholastic anymore.

I was charged twice for the same order! When I contacted your company about it they said that the was normal!?!? Not one other company I've ever done business with, and there's been thousands over the years, has ever charged me twice! By doing this,  your company has held up an extra $28.89 of money that does not belong to you and was most certainly not authorized by me,  making it a fraudulent charge by your company! So then I had to go through the process of filing a claim through my bank and they also found it to be fraudulent and returned my money immediately. Imagine if every business did business this way??? None of us would have a dime to our name!! I will not be doing business with your company again, nor will any of my family and friends and I will certainly be spreading the word about your companies unethical business practices starting with the BBB. I also plan on contacting the Federal Trade Commission and filing a complaint with them as well!  Terrie Vanover
My daughter's teacher changed the mailing address on the order and shipped it to the wrong place. And apparently there is no way to change it.
I placed an order on 15 May and randomly on 23 May it was canceled the teacher had to let me know it was canceled because you didn’t even send me an email or anything. That’s very unprofessional

The book fair is over. I was in the hospital having my 7th stroke and i got my 3rd grade daughter ID wrong. I realize it bc my sister is an administrator at her school and I promptly asked for a refund because my sister bought her book. Now this $25,gc is out in space. It’s a shame that customer service is like this now because you don’t accept cash at the book fair anymore.

I didn’t really get an answer .  I have been trying to see if the teacher I ordered from can fiancé out. I was just sent en email that my order was cancelled, when I asked for an answer as to why. I was told to contact the teacher.

I didn’t really get an answer .  I have been trying to see if the teacher I ordered from can fiancé out. I was just sent en email that my order was cancelled, when I asked for an answer as to why. I was told to contact the teacher.
Just that I LOVE all your books.......for what I do, especially the dollar books........I can afford to give to all the kids I read to❤😇💜

I've had two orders cancelled, one of which I was still charged for and I was told I would be receiving for several months. Very disappointed with Scholastic and most likley will not continue to make purchases due to the inconvenience. Terrible customer service. Impossible to get help.

I've had two orders cancelled, one of which I was still charged for and I was told I would be receiving for several months. Very disappointed with Scholastic and most likley will not continue to make purchases due to the inconvenience. Terrible customer service. Impossible to get help.

I've had two orders cancelled, one of which I was still charged for and I was told I would be receiving for several months. Very disappointed with Scholastic and most likley will not continue to make purchases due to the inconvenience. Terrible customer service. Impossible to get help.
No one helped me figure out where the books I ordered are. All the did was transfer me and leave me waiting . Completely frustrated and still have no clue where they are .
No one helped me figure out where the books I ordered are. All the did was transfer me and leave me waiting . Completely frustrated and still have no clue where they are .
Fast and quick responses for customer service
Still dont know if i will recieve the rest of my order or whom to contact with being charged for full amount and not recieving all products

I made order on February 2023 and didn’t receive it. I didn’t get order confirmation number but I was charged $25 for it. Nobody can help me because I don’t have that order number. But why did you charged me if order wasn’t made.

I made order on February 2023 and didn’t receive it. I didn’t get order confirmation number but I was charged $25 for it. Nobody can help me because I don’t have that order number. But why did you charged me if order wasn’t made.
I really appreciate that I got the response within 24 hours and the replacement shipping was already made without fee.  Thank you so much.
Customer service had a very poor communication skills. Neither interest in helping solve my problem. I’m still with my issue unresolved.

I have a charge on my card but have not made a purchase recently. The online chat tech said it can take awhile for your purchase to post. However the last time I bought scholastic was in March. It shouldn’t take that long and the tech shouldn’t convince people it would take that long.

I would have liked an email letting me know the books we ordered were not available anymore. My daughter earned those books doing chores and knew how many she was supposed to receive and is so upset to not receive the books and with no warning.

Still waiting on the answer to my question.  But Nicole Wagner went above and beyond . I got an email saying I had a negative in my account saying I owed money since I left money in my account.  I was unaware that I had any money in my account.

We purchased a journal for our daughter. In my account, I discovered I had a coupon, so used a coupon for it. Unfortunately it was unavailable, so you subbed an activity book for it. I’m seriously disappointed for a couple reasons - 1) the book I choose was a journal with a pen for a girl, it was replaced with a 4 page activity book clearly for boys and cheap looking 2) an option of substitution should have been given OR given the other book that was $3 and also on the list discounted to free.  I was not pleased with the response from customer service. What a dishonest program you are running.

We purchased a journal for our daughter. In my account, I discovered I had a coupon, so used a coupon for it. Unfortunately it was unavailable, so you subbed an activity book for it. I’m seriously disappointed for a couple reasons - 1) the book I choose was a journal with a pen for a girl, it was replaced with a 4 page activity book clearly for boys and cheap looking 2) an option of substitution should have been given OR given the other book that was $3 and also on the list discounted to free.  I was not pleased with the response from customer service. What a dishonest program you are running.

Looking for books for my 7rd old going into 3rd grade reading at a “N” or higher level. Was hoping to receive some recommendations rather than just sort through the books myself. There’s quite a long list. A few of the actual suggestions were not what we are looking for.
moe totorials my son whats to know how to go onto the slide in home base how to go down the slide in home base

My child never received her book. I asked her teacher, and she didn't know why. I asked Scholastic, and initially, they couldn't find the order and then replied that they could see it. They said her teacher did not put the order in. They said the book was out of stock and offered a coupon for $5.00. I paid $7.00 initially. Not only is my child without the book, but now they want me to pick another book that is not equivalent to the price I paid initially. I was not offered a refund, so where is the $7.00 I paid for this book in February?
Book Order #: 73269383 is overdue.. Where is it?
if  items are sold out, please notify before checkout

It's 2023! Computer do what programs (PEOPLE) tell them to do. Your system keeps sending me an invoice that has a NEGATIVE balance, so you owe me a credit, that looks like a bill and the text of the email only mentions how to PAY the invoice! I had to find the small print at the bottom of invoice talking about how to get or use a credit, which required me to call for you to send me money? Then your customer service people can't even see my account info other than my name and that I have a NEGATIVE balance and then I am told it will be reviewed and I had to supply my address IF I get sent a refund check....this from an order from Jan 2022!!! I thought this was done! All that aside, it is ridiculous that in 2023, you have not set up a system to take care of this WITHOUT requiring your customers to REQUEST a refund or sending passive aggressive emails that look like a bill when it is not a bill with no way to replay back to the email. Your phone system had ridiculous number of options NONE of which help a PARENT get to someone for the purposes of requesting this refund! The entire process was ridiculous! I am sorry if your "customer service rep" (who couldn't see anything she needed to actually help me, so worst customer service ever, but not her fault, it is your company's fault for having such a backwards, outdated system! I could tell she was a bit shocked that I was so upset, but I was FRUSTRATED that your company has drug this out over a year and still keep acting like I am the one who screwed up! All I did was place an order, that got misdelivered like 3 times because your system couldn't figure out how to  update the school's shipping address. I am not even sure if me or the school ever got the books. As of last September, I did not care anymore since I was supposed to have gotten a refund already! So please do not give your customer service rep a hard time. Get with the technology and figure out how to do this better! Your company been around since at least when I was in grade school over 40 yrs ago, sorry but that is no excuse to have such a convoluted system in 2023! If my grandmother, who is in her 80s can figure out how to use today's technology, then a company of your size should be able to!

I wished to know if there were other books by Laura Driscoll, who wrote J reader books titled.... I want to be a ....(firefighter, teacher, pilot, doctor).  The person at the other end did not address my question unfortunately.
We need to make sure we are refunded  as we never received the package
My daughter loves the book fair.

I sent the following note. My concern is not one that can be addressed via a simple email of acknowledgement. It has to do with serious systemic issues within the company. You can resolve it by publishing books that engage with race and injustice in meaningful ways and don't force authors to choose between working with you and being "whitewashed." Similarly, my nephew and his classmates enjoy your books, but I will look elsewhere if I can't get books that seriously engage important issues facing society. Those of us who believe racism is a problem that needs to be addressed buy books too.  Here is my earlier note:   I often buy books for my nephew and his classroom. Given the recent revelations about Scholastic's attempts to “dumb down” books addressing racism and other systemic forms of inequality, I am very concerned about continuing to support Scholastic. I will certainly be looking into other options and may purchase other books addressing race and racism for his classroom, rather than spending money on scholastic books.    I hope you will takes seriously the responsibilities that come with your position and stand up to the bullies who want to “whiten” our educational system. They do all of us a disservice.    Best wishes, Emilye    p.s. It shouldn’t matter, but I’m white.
Very helpful they got back to me with info very quickly
I would like the extra money in my account refunded back and I'm being told that can't be done!

I bought a book that you guys published, but didn't buy it through your website.  The book was misprinted with pages in the wrong order and missing, and you guys won't stand by your published product and replace it because I didn't buy it through your website.
The chat was quick and informative.
Thanks to the representative who tracked down my order
Not have an item missing in my order

definitely if something is not available and the order cannot be fulfilled in full, you should inform about it.  The child was waiting a whole month for the book.  And when the order came, it turned out that the one that was waiting for was not there...
Thank you for the prompt response and remedy of fixing the issue of wet books being delivered.

I just got the confirmation on my order and the address is wrong. I emailed immediately and the customer service representative said it is too late to fix it. It hasn't been processed yet. Please change the address.
My most recent contact with Scholastic customer service was exceptional.  I usually do not like the "chat"; however, it turned out to be invaluable.  Thank you and Blessings....

It would help me to understand why the addressee changed for this shipment.  I've sent the books home before and my daughter's name was used.  If this will continue to happen then I won't be able to mail the books home and my 4 year old grandson will have to carry them home.
i would have liked an email when me order was shipped

Ordered books available on the website. The teacher submitted the next day and am now told they aren’t available. My daughter will be bummed. The website confined to say they were available.  Not sure the status of remaining order. Wasn’t offered a replacement. Somewhat feels like false advertising for a child. Poor business process.
I was charged two separate charges on my credit card. I was told that one might have been a hold and that it would roll off. It has not rolled off.
Very satisfied with the quick resolution and response.
Short response that did not seem friendly, Bummed after spending almost $400 in books today.
Thank you so much!  Calling and emailing both received excellent and quick feedback, thank you for that!

Thank you for applying my birthday bonus points to my account. I would have missed out on using them before they expired because I placed my final book order last week and my birthday was on Friday. I greatly appreciate your kindness!!!
My book club order was automatically entered and now I am not able to use my bonus points to finish off the school year.

You stated that you needed different Tex form than what I sent.  Our accounting office responded the same day; we have never heard back from you. Still waiting for scholastic to send requested documents.  Due to the lack of response, I think we lost the 30% discount offer.

Confirm for me t hat next year you would make a note to send me Club Leo book orders for all my 115 third, fourth and fifth graders....instead of telling me to contact you back in the fall. I teach all the third , fourth and fifth graders intermediate Spanish lessons twice a week. I have 115 students. Far too often you would send me regular classroom order forms instead of the Club Leo ones. Since Covid and sheltering in place for a year and then slowly returning to normal....you do NOT send me flyers unless I call and complain. Sometims you still send English flyers....I only want the ones for the Spanish and bilingual books. Most often, I get nothing. I contacted you recently to ask that you make a note to send me Club Leo forms next year and was told I would need to contact you in the fall....

The person that answered the phone did minimal to help. Ultimately she said that I should call back the next day. The two people that assisted me on the live chat were awesome and very helpful. I got disconnected from the first person, when I reestablished communication the second person was very helpful

I recently noticed an outstanding balance on my account. It is apparent that three checks that I submitted months ago (in Scholastic envelope via US Postal Service) as part of my students' book club order were not accounted for. I was told that I needed to submit check numbers and bank routing information in order to research/rectify this problem. I do not have this information as these checks were not written by me, but by student's families, and we have now reached the end of the school year. I have not been in the habit of photocopying checks submitted, as I have never previously experienced a problem with check payment going astray. I certainly will in the future, as now I feel I have reached a dead end unless I am willing to research other people's personal bank information.
My book box went missing!! No one knows where it is and school ends this week, I was panicked! Customer service shipped me a new one immediately. Thank god! I couldn’t believe it. Thank you so much.

Next time an item is discontinued or unavailable, please enclose a written notice advising as such and what our options are to replace this item.  The rep I spoke to was apologetic and informed me that I should’ve gotten an email to advise me of the discontinued item.  Unfortunately I do not always have the chance to check my emails each time I receive a shipment unless I’m expecting Marc records to import to our library system.  It’s Much more convenient if a notice was also enclosed or at least written on the enclosed packing slip that the item is discontinued.  If I remember correctly, scholastic did use to send some kind of written notification with the book order if there was a delay or substitution for any item
You were out of stock on half the books my kids wanted which is super disappointing 4 an 8 year old. There was not an option for no contact needed, but I did not contact customer, service about it
I am anxious to order books for my new endeavor.
Thank you for positively and easily resolving my need.

My order was automatically submitted and it didn't even get submitted when the email said it was. This was a major problem as I lost access to all the rewards I could have gotten that month. I have never not submitted a monthly order before so I don't know why it did that.

I am frustrated that the "system" determined that our school would not receive our order before it released for the summer. I don't know how the system knows when our last day is for the year. I would like the system to trust that teachers know when to submit orders and when it is too late to receive them. I had a parent order cancelled long before our order due date because the "system" thought we would be out of school before it was ordered. Then the class order was submitted after that and the parent had to resubmit the order and have it shipped to home. Plus the email the parent received regarding their cancelled order was two weeks after they placed the order, and after the classroom order had been submitted. Entirely too late to avoid this problem entirely.
The representative was helpful and took care of my question and transferred my points without me having to do anything!

I can't think of anything. I've been an educator for more than 30 years. I have been involved with Scholastic for many years, but I'm not sure how long. I love receiving the coupons and the value. I am inspired to put books in my students' hands. I love being able to shop from the $1 store.  I am frustrated that you have to spend $25 in order to spend the coupon. I am offended that the customer service rep thinks that I can't read that  I have to spend $25 when I already have a cart full of more than $70.
Email was so quick and easy.  Thank-you.
My order was auto submitted. Leaving delivery for a time that no one will be at the school, and  i won’t be around the building to go by and get it.
The situation was my fault.  I didn't read closely.  This was the first time a kid had his things sent to his house and not the school.  I appreciate the quick response to my question.  Thanks!
Thank you for replacing my order that never arrived. I appreciate your positive  customer service. Thank you!
Got back to me very quickly--solved my issue promptly.

My interaction with the representative was pleasant and she was professional. However, I was disappointed that the item was interested in is only available in a set with other books that I do not need. The book that I wanted to purchase in bulk is Curious You On Your Way.
provide requested sales receipt with tax credit

14 of the 27 purchase orders were not placed by your company based on the quotes your company gave our school.  Now it's the end of our school year and those teachers did not receive their books I ordered for them.
My responses & help is always so pleasant & prompt with scholastic. I appreciate your company's professionalism and products!

I spoke with Megan who was a big help, and I was satisfied with our conversation and her attempt to make things right. My student online order had been auto-submitted. Because of this, I was not able to: include my order for student book gifts using my bonus points,  use my code for extra bonus points 20325    nor receive my $10 free books with my student order. I don't see any advantage to this new feature. I would appreciate a coupon for $10 free books and/or bonus points in the fall if at all possible.  I am placing a separate order form my gift books for my students. The auto submit just defeats the purpose as I would think most teachers combine all the rewards and bonus points they can. Thank you for your consideration and for listening to my concerns.  Sincerely, Corinne Beyer Please see first response.

It would be great if Scholastic just emailed us coupon codes one time rather than multiple times (unless they say "Don't forget to use your coupon, if you haven't already!" or something similar).  I thought a new coupon code had been emailed out because it mentioned summer reading...but it was just the May coupon code for Golden Apple teachers--the same one I'd already gotten and used.  I love to get reminders to use coupons--but clearly state that they are reminders, not new coupon codes!  Thanks Scholastic, for listening!
I just let Scholastic know that I never received my book order. I am waiting for confirmation that they are sending it out to me. I'm sure they are working on it.

It was several days after I made contact that my damaged book replacement was finally shipped.  Hoping that it arrives before our last day of school so that I can give it to the student who chose it for their prize.
Communication is great... twice this school year I did not get all the books that were ordered.

I wanted to order several new beginning chapter book series for my first graders with an Accelerated Reader/Grade Equivalent Level of something in the vicinity of 3.5 to 3.5.  I was told I could look through all the titles that Scholastic sells to find what I need.  I know I could do that.  I wanted it narrowed down to what I was looking for--perhaps some new series' that I'm not familiar with.   I didn't get even a little bit of narrowing down.

I wanted to order several new beginning chapter book series for my first graders with an Accelerated Reader/Grade Equivalent Level of something in the vicinity of 3.5 to 3.5.  I was told I could look through all the titles that Scholastic sells to find what I need.  I know I could do that.  I wanted it narrowed down to what I was looking for--perhaps some new series' that I'm not familiar with.   I didn't get even a little bit of narrowing down.
It's always better to talk to a human.  The service prompted me to departments I didn't need, nor have the time to deal with.

It's a great program. I'd love to see more Middle School Specific Magazines with more titles - seeing the same titles in magazines can sometimes be "lame" for my MS kids, lol. :) Also, it would be AWESOME if there was a "student viewing" friendly section on your website so when I put out book orders, students can more easily view books/items for purchase online. I'd love for kids to be able to see book trailers or even authors talking about their books when they go online to browse. They love the magazines AND since they have to order online and there's so much more online anyway, it'd be nice to let them have access online without needing their parents/family's account. I just want to say that my previous comments are not from a dissatisfied customer. These are just some areas I see that could enhance the experience with Scholastic Book Clubs.
Communication was made via email and issue was resolved. Thank you for your kind words!

Do NOT automatically send out the students book orders. Wait until the teachers approve it, so we can order books for the classroom and everything can all be sent at once. Saves everyone time and money! I would like your company to change your policy regarding this issue. All the teachers at my school do not like the new policy.

I have a year round child care program that serves children and families infant through pre-kindergarten and was disappointed to find out that scholastic does not have early childhood flyers for the summer months. I am aware that many schools are closed for summer break in June through August but there are early childhood programs that are too young for your K-2nd grade Summer Reading Flyers and would benefit from having the early childhood flyers continue for June-August.
The CSR was quick in her responses, efficient, and friendly.  Thank you! :)
I misplaced my coupon to spend from April's order on May's order, the representative was not helpful with providing me with a coupon number to use.

I am looking for the catalog of items that may be purchased using points.  The person told me where to look and what to look for.  But it was not there.  I closed everything and decided to try again today.  There is still no teacher exclusives on the page.
I am still unclear on why my educator account was not verified for next school year and what I need to do to fix this issue.
Thank you for providing a response to my question and resolving the information I needed.
You guys are great. Keep those current titles coming!

I had a student order placed automatically through the auto-submit option, despite me not wanting it to auto-submit.     I had two student orders totaling ~$96 dollars in my cart, as well as a teacher order, that I was going to place today.  One of the student orders auto-submitted at 4 a.m., so I lost out on the 200 bonus points I was supposed to receive because without it my order went down to ~$34,  When I contacted customer service to rectify this, they stated that emails were sent regarding the auto submit occurring today, but I have not received one communication that it was going to occur.  I would have placed my order prior to this date to avoid the hassle and losing of those points unnecessarily.  The only communication regarding any auto-submit was on the student's initial order email and it stated that it would occur at the end of the month, not 5/22.  The customer service rep did not offer to provide me with my lost points or any real solution besides calling to add items, which is a huge hassle with a large order and limited time to do so.  I'm also confused as to why both student orders did not submit automatically either, despite both being in my cart at the same time.

I have 23,000+ points in my point bank to use for books for my students.  I am very dissatisfied with the items I can choose from to use those points.  Those points were accumulated by purchasing books, and that is what my students need.  They do not need pointers, stickers, toys, trinkets, etc. I need to use those points when checking out and ordering books that my students need.

The new auto-submitting process.  I was never notified via email, even though your customer service rep says email went out 5/18 and follow up on 5/20.  This I never saw and I see this as an inconvience due to making my end time 5/22 at 11:59pm for my families of my classroom.
IF I could have made the changes on the original survey, I wouldn't have had to bother one of your representatives
Theresa handled my issues in a very timely manner and was extremely helpful!!

I received a gift card from a student after our scholastic book fair left. I want to shop at a physical location because I don't want to pay $9 shipping, but I can't take days off to attend another school's book fair. Don't know what I'm going to do yet.
The first representative was unable to help me and didn't seem interested in listening to my concerns.  When I spoke to a supervisor she was able to listen and help resolve my problem.

My issue was a gift card I received for teacher appreciation wasn’t loading. I had to speak to multiple different people, over the course of 2 days and over and hour and a half of my time time to get the problem resolved. I was even asked to reach back out to the parent to see if they would be willing to resend it etc  👀🙈im sorry but that’s seemed unprofessional, and it wasn’t the parent’s mistake to fix.  Anyways, the whole situation was ridiculous on top of the fact that any person, especially and educator, our time is precious and it wasn’t handled well at all. I miss the dollar books and hate how you now have to wait to earn/ enter your rewards until the next month instead of letting us choose our books instantly like we used to be able to.  Again, teachers don’t have time to look to find and/or remember the coupons.  Stop making things difficult or I’m out.
Very helpful and resolved my issue quickly. Thanks so much!
Provide a better response I ordered a $100 Target Gift Card using my Bonus Points on March 17th. I still have not received it.
Provide a better response I ordered a $100 Target Gift Card using my Bonus Points on March 17th. I still have not received it.
She was wonderful.  She was calm and took the time to figure out my issues with the account.  I appreciated her help and highly recommend her.

I was calling about an order that was auto shipped from scholastic instead of processed by me. You rushed to send the order but the student did not receive 3 items they purchased. Perhaps the order should not have been rushed. I think the auto shipping is a terrible idea! It is going to cause many problems. It has already caused me many.

Teachers spend A LOT of money on books. I spent money throughout the entire year to build points. Now allowing me to use my points that I accumulated on my gift books to my students is EXTREMELY disappointing.
I felt as though my question was being brushed off. Very disappointed that the response was "Sorry, that's just the way it is."

I have requested a copy of our invoice for Order # 71785223 on account  53409120 three times.  Twice today via chat, and once by phone on 5/12 and have not received this yet.  I asked for a copy to be sent to both myself at amykrultz@tomah.education and my co-worker meredithgrovesteen@tomah.education.  I have not received anything.  You could try to email to my old email address:  amykrultz@tomah.k12.wi.us.

I had a student order an item that is apparently out of stock.  I did not have anything on my packing slip to indicate that.  The mom said she did not receive anything to let her know that the book was out of stock.  She assumed her item was still coming.  Your customer service member told me that the item was out of stock.  When I asked if the parent was notified, I was told the parent was not charged.  I understand that, but I am not sure the mom realized that  and was still expecting her order.

I think my problem was solved, but chat ended and I'm not sure if the problem was solved. (I had a parent order online and put the child's last year teacher name instead of mine.  She did not order this year.  I think the books will be sent but not sure. School is out June 1)
Your representative was kind, quick and efficient with handling my concern. Thank you
The team was amazing. They responded almost quickly and solved my problem the same day!
I had online orders that were processed BEFORE I completed the "action needed".   Then I had one that wasn't.  I'm STILL waiting on that one.

We are a school that is tax exempt and cannot pay sales tax with our credit card.  I was told they cannot take tax off the order but I could select partial payment and not choose to pay the tax.  I do not see that option when I check out.
The online chat as well as 800 number customer service staff are fabulous!  They have always worked to find a positive solution for any questions or concerns I have.

The issues are from before I started working at LES and I have been asking for information to try in help in the process of locating packing slips for the double orders Scholastic is speaking of.  I emailed for 2 weeks before getting a packing slip on just 1 book and then Rita Kroll emails my district office again, even though she was the one I was emailing for two weeks, asking for updates as if I was doing nothing to help.  I am very dissatisfied with her and how she has handled this situation.  I am trying to fix a problem from over 2 years ago with no books to show or packing slips and I am just asking for help.  An have invoices that they are asking for us to pay at the end of a school year or they are going to shut us off.  Our budget is almost at zeros and we are doing all we can to help, but Rita is not helping in this situation.

When I replied to the message I received in response to my inquiry, I quickly received an email letting me know that my reply was not delivered because “the recipients inbox was full”. This led me to believe that my reply wasn’t received. I’m not sure if this is an automatic outgoing message, but it was very frustrating thinking that I wasn’t able to continue our communication about my issue. Thankfully someone did respond, and we were able to resolve my issue. Not at this time.

You advertise a poetry book Out of Wonder for 2.00 per book which is higher than the 1.00 books I usually purchase for my students.  I put in the order and get an email saying the book is now 5.61.  I ask why?  I'm told there are different prices for different markets!  Really?  That is not honoring children and very inequitable.  I am on a strict budget.  I ask if I increase the order quantity would we get he book at 2.  or even 1.00 for each.  I was told no, the book is now offered at 5.61 per book.  If you can resolve this, I need 22 books for my classroom.  Thanks.

I received an eGift card but do not know who sent it. The person who responded to the email said it was sent from my own account. I do not recall purchasing that and it is not on any of my past orders. I still am wondering who sent it.
The representative I spoke with was very helpful and handled things in a very timely manner which I greatly appreciate!

I ordered a gift card on 4/28. I understand they take 2-4 weeks to ship. Our building is closed for the summer starting next week.  I wanted to have it shipped to a different address considering it hasn't even shipped yet. Lisa was less than helpful and just shot that idea down immediately with no other resolution other than I am SOL and will have to wait until it gets returned back to you all. I asked to cancel the order and then re order it and that was also immediately shut down. However, she did let me know that I could reorder the gift card. That would be a great solution if I had another 12.5K bonus points sitting in my bonus point bank. My issue is I will have to wait ANOTHER 2-4 weeks minimum once it gets sent back to you.
This was the first time I used the chat options. This was so much faster than waiting on hold!  Thank you for that option!!!
Not changed the status of my account without notice or request.
Excellent customer service! Very quick response and resolution.
Provided the tracking number I asked for Still haven’t gotten package

The wait time took to long for me to repond with students present. Decided that I didnt want to wait and didn't care about the coupon and ended up not ordering more. I HATE that I now have to wait a month to use a coupon versus instant bonus. I am not sure how often I will do book orders because of this change.
Chat option was very efficient and easy to use.

I had placed an order for the end of the year, which I did on line.  You usually do a nice job of informing me if an item is out of stock.  After the order had been placed, I received notification that one item was no longer available.  I called that day to try and get another book put in with the order as a replacement.  I was too late.  I used bonus points to purchase the book, but had to pay for shipping.  I felt that was a little unfair since I could have made the replacement if I had known the item was no longer available at the time of the first ordering.  To have to pay for shipping when it was not my error seems a little unfair to me, especially when I am a good customer.  I do not hold the repesentative at fault since he was following protocol.
I appreciated the rep, who was easy to talk to and got things done.

Well I was a little disappointed that you did not offer a book that I was trying to get my class to buy on your book clubs list anymore.  Gregor the overlander. The people that I speak with are always polite and helpful!
My order could have been correct, and I could have be notified that an item was no longer available.
I am very grateful for Scholastic!

In my last order, there was an issue in a discrepancy between a parent and myself, and what they ordered. I was on In my last order, there was a issue in a discrepancy between a parent and myself, and what they ordered. I was on a live chat, but had to go back to teaching so I kept getting disconnected. Checked I need someone to check my last order for Gabriel Álvarez because his mom has a different order number from me and they are missing a book. Please use my email at careyks@unit5.org

Just put the points on my account instead of saying I have to remember to ask again May 31. If the points would automatically be added when I meet the requirements it would just make it easier for everyone! They said I have to message again May 31
The representative was prompt and very helpful!

Wait time was a little long for dealing with shoppers and waiting. I also called on 5/15 to resolve an ongoing issue.  During our Fall fair I was told by a rep that for our teacher shoppers could not check them books using Scholastic Dollars nor could we keep the books that were at our fair.  Rather, I had to sit on the phone for 45 minutes with titles and then these title were later shipped to us (if they were available....)  However on 5/15 I spoke with a different rep who said Oh NO you can simply purchase the titles with Scholastic Dollars from register.  This is what we have been doing during the fair.  I am hopeful that the 5/15 representative was correct.
I have not received an answer  to the question.
Love scholastic handled my damanges items like a pro. Quick easy and replacements were sent. Loved it. I wish every company worked this well for us!
I appreciate the quick response and correction on the mistake that was made!  There was no hassle and it was very smooth!

I wish that Scholastic would have put a notification in my book box so I could have communicated with the parents without having to contact scholastic.  My live text representative was wonderful and helped tremendously, however, I should have never had to contact Scholastic.  There was noting on my packing slip that indicated that anything was missing.  I felt silly when the parent contacted me and I didn't have a clue anything was missing.  You all clearly knew that the item was no longer available.  This should have been taken care of on your end before it ever got to me.
Gift card given online isn’t showing up. I never received the $25 credit

"Fabulous Like a Fox" has been an item in your catalogues off and on this entire school year.  We managed to get one however it was ordered at least 4 times that I can remember and the last one (5/15) we were told it is no longer available. Why put it in the order catalogue if it's not and why didn't the warehouse send something in its place or at least a note that I could give to the student?
There is a "ghost" order in my account and I would like it removed.
I want to know is theres more inventory and no answer

My order was automatically submitted and I entered my $10 free book coupons.  It did not go through and I did not receive the books. I have been trying to get it resolved.  It's been time consuming and back/forth emails.  Truly disappointing for all of the book orders I have submitted throughout the years.
I have already paid for my books and now they are saying that I haven't paid.
A book ordered by a parent online was missing from my order . I used online chat and was sent out right away.
My problem was resolved with a phone call.

I was not notified my missing items were backordered. When I chatted with a rep, she was very professional and Polite. I should have been notified my item was not in the box and not available. She indicated it should read the same on my packing slip and it was not. I didn’t get N email either. How was I to know about the missing items. No communication whatsoever from scholastic
the support was great, thank you

the summer packets need adidiotnal infomraiton in their description. my quesiton was basic and could've been answered had it been included in the descriptions: is the summer packet for rising 2nd graders or those who have just completed 2nd grade and moving into 3rd grade (rising 3rd graders) the first person I chatted with was rather rude
I am frustrated with the shipping charges.  I understand they may be necessary, but the teacher should not be responsible for paying it if he/she is not ordering.

The last few months your website signs me out while I am ACTIVELY putting in orders.  When it logs me out it ERASES THE ENTIRE ORDER! it took me three tries (2 hours) before I was able to submit my order.
They were very willing to listen to what happened and help to remedy the situation.

In submitting my class order online, it was tricky (not user friendly) with locating the section to redeem and use bonus point.  I had to call Scholastic to walk me through it. Besides that, I love Scholastic!

I just haven't heard for sure what was decided about the Science Color Blast Kit my student was to have received. The person who helped me was checking into it. I just want to know whether the science Color Blast Kit wasn't available since my student received something else.

My only issue is confusing statements I am sent that suggest I have a debt -- when, in fact, it is a credit.  This has happened twice in recent years -- and I do not want to receive these messages again.

After 40 minutes, I did not get a clear explanation as to why I owed $9.55.  Your representative tried very hard to figure it out, but finally wrote off the overcharge.  I appreciate that, but it took a long time on the phone during a busy school day.
Better communication up front about how we receive our target gift cards, then I wouldn't have had to take the time to reach out.
They could have been a little faster in responding. But, I was in a hurry and that might affect my judgement. No problem.
None.  The person helping was very nice and helpful.

I emailed with the subject line stating Sales Tax Credit in the subject (as previously told to me). I explained why I was emailing and included the invoice number and all other pertinent information. I then received 2 identical emails just stating that my order had been delivered:  Hello    I see your order shipped with UPS tracking number 1Z1W1R130322037402. Your order arrived at Wednesday April 19th at 11:45 a.m. and was signed for by Mcmannoh. For further questions or assistance you can respond to this email or call 1-800-724-6527 to reach our customer service team.  Sincerely Hailey CSR with Scholastic Book Clubs  This did not address my email at all and my tax credit still has not been resolved.

I have described the situation through email. They email me back asking questions that I have already answered in my previous emails. I am now having to take the time to reexplain the situation and provide double information. This is extremely frustrating and wasting my time.
I was missing an item from order 73422431item !s8 The adventures of Captain Underpants 25 (CAPT UNDERP #1 (DOG MAN COMIC).  He said he would reorder it but I cannot find an order for this.
Correct stuff in box the first time.

The frustration arose from an auto-submitted online order, which prevented another student from ordering her books without having to pay pay postage because the online order was not counted as part of the classroom order. Further, it prevented the eligibility for the promotion, which was a $10.00 book for the classroom library.
When I asked my question, the response I received was a blank email.  I had to send another email to get a response. Something is wrong with billing, I got billed 3 times for the same products.
When I asked my question, the response I received was a blank email.  I had to send another email to get a response. Something is wrong with billing, I got billed 3 times for the same products.
The representative was very helpful.  I was extremely satisfied with my interaction with her.
I was trying to ask if I still have my bonus points from a few years ago, but they ended the chat without answering my question
Thank you for assisting! You were very helpful!
The representative that helped me was very professional and helpful.
Been a little more flexible with options from the beginning of our conversation.
Applied my digital gift card to my recently purchased order Digital gift certificates should be an option as payment, even after the order has been placed.
Answered  my question in more detail I do not understand why there is a balance owed on my account
clearance books at $1 or less per for economically distressed areas
I am happy that my orders are arriving on time.
Because educators will need to make tax exempt purchases, it would be helpful to have that info on your website rather than having to go through a customer rep to get it.
I appreciate how my issue was resolved. Thank you so much!
I had to step away from the chat for 2 minutes and it had closed out by the time I got back.  I had to email myself the report so that I could see that it had been resolved.
I do not like the autosubmit feature.

I feel the company could have tried to search a little instead of me having to get the parent to go back and search.  I realize you deal with thousands of checks but there should have been a way to search for it. The ladies that I spoke with on the phone were extremely pleasant and kind!
Thanks for your speedy response!  I appreciate it.

Your representatives are very courteous and helpful but unless you do all on line you do not seem to want our business.  i have been a big supporter until the last two years.  Scholastic books are my favorite!!!!!
The online book order form is confusing. I had to get help because I couldn’t figure out how to delete bonus points.
Great help with invoices and corrections, very quick response.  Thank you for your help.
No concerns but I wanted you to know that Julie at customer service was excellent! Polite and accurate. Great job Julie!
There is a $20 balance on my account that has been mailed in.  However I still received an invoice for it.  I was told to use my own payment to pay for it.

I would not like my orders in my cart to be automatically released in the future. I have been utilizing online ordering for many years and have never had this happen before this order. It was very frustrating and messes up everything.
It would be very helpful if we have a tax exemption certificate on file that tax is just not charged.  We shouldn't have to wait and email asking for the tax to be removed.
Please remove me from your email as I am no longer teaching, thank you
Customer service was fast, helpful, and professional. Hailey was able to look up my order and resolve the issue making the process extremely easy.
I wish there was a way to provide a tax exempt form with my order. It is cumbersome to have to pay, then requesst that taxes be reimbursed.

I contacted Scholastic to change the delivery address, as I received an email that my order was being returned to the Sender. I was told that I would need to place the order again and then wait for my first purchase to be credited back to me. I didn't think it was a big deal to change a delivery address, but apparently it can't be done. As a teacher, I can't afford to make multiple orders and wait for my money to possibly be refunded. I asked that the order be cancelled and am still awaiting my credit. I will likely end up spending twice as much and ordering the books from Amazon, as I have done in the past when Scholastic failed to deliver my books on time. It will cost a small fortune, but I would like my students to have an end of the school year book. Scholastic doesn't appear to be able to deliver on their promises and has been a disappointment once again. I will be seeking other book clubs for my students and will be advising colleagues of the same. Amazon may be more expensive, but at least I know that the books will be delivered on time. As a long time educator, I am really upset.
Nothing Finally someone explained the Green Apple Status.
I was upset that they put my on-line orders through without my approval. I had other orders I was waiting on.  It took away from my total order.

We used to be able to use our bonus dollars on the order we were placing. Now we get a coupon in the box to be used next month. I like the old way better. If parents do not order one month then we do not get to use our bonus dollars without paying shipping. Or we forget to use the coupon that was sent.  It was much more user friendly the old way.
The website is a bit confusing for those of us just purchasing for ourselves and not a class.
I contacted customer service via live chat. I felt the customer service representative, Lisa, was curt. She lacked professionalism and friendliness in her written correspondences.
I used my 10.00 coupon to buy something.  It didn't come.  When I asked, I can only get another coupon, but I am not ordering in May so it isn't helpful.

The Customer Service rep with whom I spoke was very professional and quite ably assisted me.  The book box we received was not well packed and I had to hand out bent books to our parents.  These books are not cheap and I wasn't comfortable handing out bent books due to packing and shipping issues.

Do not change account roles unless they have been inactive or asked to be changed. I had to contact Scholastic for 2 different accounts. Both issues were resolved for both accounts but it was the same issue on both accounts. Both accounts were changed from educator roles to parent roles. 1 account I had just created as I was just hired as the library aide for Fall 2023. I am glad these issues resolved.
Book orders are automatically submitted. The teacher does not have the opportunity to use promotional coupons or bonus points. My bonus point order was charged shipping.

Customer service has always been very helpful.  This is just a comment about your Dollar Store.  It would be nice if the dollar books were open to teachers for an order that was around 25 to 30 dollars.  75 dollars is a lot for a small, rural, poor community.  I like to add books to my classroom library and the school district rarely will give the money towards this.  If it was a smaller amount, I would be able to get more books into the hands of my students.  Just a thought.

I have a $59 credit on my account. When I asked about this, they said that it was for a check. If the check was for a student order that was never filled, I would like the check to be voided and cleared from my account so that I don't use this month accidentally with a future order.
I was confused that when I selected to use my points on a value pack that I was getting another value pack.

I needed to use bonus points to order some books but my online orders were automatically closed out.  I didn't realize that happens automatically at the end of the month.  (By the way, that does NOT work for all teachers.) I was frustrated that I would have to pay for shipping since i could not add my bonus points to my order since it was already closed and shipped out.  I received a email response very shortly after and my shipping fee was refunded to me.  I appreciate the kindness and prompt response so much!!
I cannot log on to put in online student orders or to check to see the status of classroom orders.  I keep getting sent to a site as if I were a parent.
I had two representatives reach out to me, one within minutes, and another the following business day. I appreciate the timeliness of this, even when it was not necessary.
Inputting student online orders was not always user friendly. The chat is still too robotic--not always connecting to a person easily.

I had my student orders submitted automatically, so I didn't get to use the bonus rewards or coupons that could apply to my order. I had student orders that would have opened up the Dollar Shop, but I didn't get to utilize this. I am very unhappy with this new procedure.

My concern was having my teacher order submitted automatically without first notifying me. I received email notification 2 days AFTER the order was submitted. This prevents me from ordering year end books for my students because I can not get the free shipping nor can I use my bonus points. Additionally the May perks for teachers were very very slim and the book prices have gone up significantly. I realize this is an unprecedented time for inflation but these two features of the Scholastic order process have made it a lot harder for me to put books in the hands of my students. I will NOT be ordering year-end books for my class this year for the first time in 10 years. It's a shame.

Parent orders have been put on "Auto submit".  This caused a great deal of problems in accumulating the correct amount needed in order for the $1 store to OPEN.  Something that used to be so simple required much too much additional time for me this month.  I had to add my total orders together in order to see if I had accumulated enough.  This "auto-submit" was not in place in the beginning of the year.  I had to contact customer service THREE TIMES!  One to question what/why it happened.  Again to ask that the $1 Store be opened so that I could make a purchase.  And yet a third time to place my order!  Valuable time wasted.  While the customer service reps were courteous, your system is broken.  It was never broken to begin with so why "fix it"!    I quit using Scholastic during/after the Covid because of the response time in receiving books and the availability of books.  That was a direct reflection on me and I had to field the emails asking where books were.  I have slowly begun to get back into them.  But now since this "new" system, I'll think long and hard about continuing for next year, as well.

I called regarding the automatic ordering feature that placed my book order for me. I would like this feature removed from my account. This feature split my order apart and I was not able to use my coupon that I had earned from the month prior. One of your customer service representatives was able to remedy that for me, but it caused me to have one more thing to do in my already busy day. This feature did not make my job easier. It added to my stress! Splitting orders can also impact bonus points earned each month. Please remove the automatic ordering feature from my account. Thank You! I would like the automatic ordering feature removed now. I do not want to wait until the fall. I cannot imagine under any circumstance that this feature would be a convenience to me.
They responded quickly and fixed the issue quickly.

The auto-submission of orders in the cart is unacceptable.  I understand some teachers may forget to submit orders, but I am not one of them.  To have my order submitted before I am ready is extremely frustrating since I could not use points or order items for myself.  Yes, customer service helped me complete my order but am so upset about the time, effort, and hassle of this experience that I am thinking of not using Scholastic in the future.
Not submitting my order before it was due and then not explaining why it was submitted.  It only was explained after I contacted you. Your representative that chatted with me was helpful.  Keep her!

There was no reason that my order should have been automatically submitted when I did not have the chance to submit my paper orders and given the families time until my due date. I lost the chance of earning my May rewards and free shipping. Due to the increase in prices over the past year and now this new policy I will not be asking parents to order next school year. It is not worth educators' time.
Part of my order was canceled. I would have liked to have seen that on my statement that came with the rest of my books so I didn’t have to take the time to seek out what happened.
It seemed as if my response to my questions was a canned comment which did not really answer my question.
The representative tried her best to solve the issue at hand and was proactive in retrieving an item number.

It had nothing to do with the customer service. I am just frustrated that my end of year order was automatically submitted when my due date was a week later and I had earned more bonus points since I had a larger total. I just wish it wasn't automatically submitted!

When I initially called, Rebecca was helping me.  We were disconnected, because of trouble on my end.  When I called back, I received a different representative who was extremely helpful.  Rebecca had already resolved the issue, prior to my call back.  Excellent customer service.
The customer service representative was very helpful and resolved my issue in a timely manner.
Very prompt and emailed me right away. Thanks
My problem was solved instantly. Jennifer was very helpful!
My book box was submitted without my consent so I was unable to use my April coupons. They told me to call in order to resolve my issue.
It was great . I thought I was supposed to get a free item with my last order.  Some teachers Received a Pokémon poster .   That was all.

No problems My issue was that my order was submitted automatically before I was ready to submit it.  I understand that next year I will be able to opt out of that so that I can finish my order before it is submitted.

Auto submitting my order was not acceptable. Saying that I should just call and spend 15-20 minutes on the phone and hope I could get the free shipping, adjusted bonus points, and additions to the order fixed is questionable.
I did not speak to anyone yesterday. I will check my email this morning. It is possible that I was not available yesterday when they tried to contact me.

Your new practice of auto submitting my order has not been a good thing.  I set a due date and you auto submitted it three days before the date.  It was sent in before I could finalize things with parents and collect all the possible bonus points and use any of them.  Now I have two more orders that I were not included with my order that I have to go in and submit myself.  Please go back to allowing teachers the control of placing their own orders.
On the postal address is missed the STE 575
I did not want my student orders automatically submitted. Especially before the due date I provided to families.

lI do not like the automatic submissions at the end of the month.   I do not do book orders each month.  I only do them 3-4 times a year, so the automatic submissions at the end of a month do not work for me. What I would suggest instead is to give teachers 3 weeks from the first order placed before doing an automatic submission.  I called & sent a message right away in the morning after the submission hoping to have the submission reversed so I could keep it open for 4 more days when my due date ended.  It was not possible.  At least from the info received from the customer service representative I will be allowed to add on any other orders to the one placed so I can receive my teacher deals.  That is good news, however it will be more work for me since I have to call and again and get the link for me to do my teacher order as well as any deals.

We are a tax exempt school. It is frustrating to have to call in each time, I order for the school, to have our taxes removed. Can’t it just be kept on file and adjusted with each order automatically?
The website is hard for me to use to o get my free books.
Customer service was good but do not like that orders can be automatically submitted.  This caused my classroom order to be submitted in several orders instead of one.
The service representative made it so easy.
I do not like the automatic submission of book orders.  I was told I could opt out in the future, and I will plan on doing that.
got my invoice w/in 5 min - great service!

The service was excellent and the Representative knew the answer right away.  Sadly, it wasn't the answer I hoped for.  I was hoping that the Scholastic Warehouses had re-opened the in-person Scholastic Warehouse Sales.  I went once in 2017, as a student teacher.  Now I have my own classroom and I would LOVE to get a pallet of stuff!!!!

I do not recall requesting emails from your organization. Although I think you are a wonderful resource for children’s literacy, I am retired and do not have grandchildren. Please remove my name from your email list. Thank you. Just remove me from your email list!!!!!

The first person I talked to was not helpful or seemed to know what was going on so I called back. The second person I talked to was helpful and able to help me figure out a solution I was happy with! The second customer service agent did great. The first did not!
You submitted by order before i had time to order anything.

Be more clear on whether paper flyers for Book Club will be sent or if it is all online now. I was in touch with a representative through the chat who said she would have them sent to us, but we never received them and it has been a couple months. Be clear on the website if paper flyers are being sent or if it is all online now.
nothing really - it was fine Dont' Auto Ship orders!!!

It was not the person on the phone issue.  It is a scholastic issue.  I could not understand why some of my book order had been processed.  I was trying to merge them onto one page and wasn't able to.  I spent 45 minutes trying to figure out what was going on.  The lady on the phone explained why I wasn't able to merge them.  I do not think scholastic should automatically process orders when they have no idea when the deadline for my students is.  Makes things very confusing when things are not all together.
Rep was very helpful and courteous.
Yes. My account was reset to Teacher from Parent, which should've never been parent. But I did not learn of my customer number.

I’m not a fan of the automatic submission of on-line orders at the end of the month. I  like setting the due date and submitting one order. I also don’t care for having to use a code to redeem my free $10.00 of books. I liked being able to choose when I placed my order.
I didn't catch his name, but your customer service representative was so polite, professional, and worked to explain and solve my problem!  He was absolutely great!

I appreciate all of your customer service representatives. Anytime I have ever had to call for help, my issue has always been resolved and your customer service representatives are so polite and helpful!
Not charge teachers for shipping fees when their student orders are not over $25.

The representative was excellent.  I don't like the way the books are being sent when ordered online and not waiting for me to send it all together.  I had a coupon and couldn't use is because I had nothiing in my cart, but my students spent over the $10.  That's why I called in.

I was unable to apply the credit from my students online orders because they are now processed automatically. I had a very small cash order that I had to make and was unable to get free shipping. My total order should have earned me free shipping and reward points, but because scholastic chose to process all parent online orders automatically, teachers are being punished. I don’t have time in my schedule or in my day to call about such matters. Even online chatting is inconvenient with my limited time. I’m not sure why this change was made but when it takes away perks for a teacher and causes them, undue stress with phone calls, and online chats, it’s just not worth it.
Since I am retiring, I would like to close my account.  However, I was told it could not be done at this time. I am retiring and need to close my book club account permanently.
My request was resolved quickly and correctly. Thank you!
Your new policy of auto-submit needs to have an opt-out option. I want to be in control of when I submit an order.
I had to contact Scholastic twice before I got a response back. Their information that they gave me does not match the most recent bill I received.

Last week on the website it had a book for people to purchased call The Lemonade War by Jacqueline Davies. It was even on sale for 2.00. I emailed all 60 of my families that I teach and told them to purchase this book from Scholastic because this was their summer reading book going into 3rd grade next school year. Well now the book is not for sale and none can tell me when it will be for sale.
Be more willing to help and fix the issue without giving me extra steps to complete. I had to do 3 things to get my issue resolved.
My order was submitted automatically and I was not able to submit my order when I wished to get my $10 back to school money. This was not able to be provided.

I have had to contact Scholastic twice today for some unfortunate situations resulting from the change to auto-submitting student orders.  On both occasions I have worked with the online chat function with great success. The situations were handled quickly and without any argument - and I've been completely satisfied with the outcomes which have been fair.

My order was auto-submitted, which was upsetting in itself because I didn't get a chance to add anything.  Second, when it was auto-submitted only half of  the order was included so I didn't get my 200 bonus points rewards for the total order.
Got the help I needed quickly.

The online prices now match the flyer price. Do the prices in the flyer include tax? I thought they did (my understanding was that is why the parents only pay the price listed and no additional tax) However, that same price is now the online price plus sales tax is added on. Which would mean parents ordering online pay more then those sending in a check and that we pay more then the flyer prices since theirs include tax and ours doesn't) Please clarify. Thank you.
I had orders auto submitted but when I was given a code to get the $10 in free books--it did not work.
customer service is taking a long time to respond and can't find a record of my order number or return
I was told the book was on back order.  Then I was told it was available. Then I couldn't buy it because it said N/A, and now it's not an option.
Never automatically submit my online parent orders. This morning I received an email that my online orders had been submitted and that created havoc.

I was re-issued a valid gift book code for one that didn't work.  I had already submitted an order earlier today so when I tried to use the coupon for a free book for a student,  I was getting charged for shipping - which was more than the free book!  Is it possible to enclose the free book in my previous order so I don't have to ask the parent for $7.00 for shipping for a free book? I was re-issued a valid gift book code for one that didn't work.  I had already submitted an order earlier today so when I tried to use the coupon for a free book for a student,  I was getting charged for shipping - which was more than the free book!  Is it possible to enclose the free book in my previous order so I don't have to ask the parent for $7.00 for shipping for a free book?
Don’t cut off a conversation before someone finishes talking. If I wait awhile for you don’t just answer and sign off. That was frustrating.
Contact with customer service was quick and easy. My problem was resolved without any trouble. Thank you!
i DO NOT WANT MY BOOK ORDERS AUTOMATICALLY SUBMITTED. i WANT TO SUBMIT THEM MYSELF.

By adding Auto-submit to my classroom book orders you have taken away any incentive I have to order. I have no more access to extra dollars earned or the Dollar Book Store because I cannot aggregate my orders. You probably should have made this change over the summer and rolled it out at the beginning of the school year. I don't have time to call customer service to get this straightened out, especially at this time of year, as was suggested in the customer service email. Consider me not a fan of taking the time to send home book club flyers and organize a book order for Scholastic any longer.

I am frequently revising my order based on my wants.  I had previously entered my coupon for $10 of books in April so that I wouldn't forget it, but when I went back it was gone and I did forget it.  Customer service did help me out, but saving those things if we bounce back and forth would be nice.  I am getting older and forgetting things more and more. Thank you for listening.
My entire cart emptied and I have lost out on the book of the week specials I had in there and re-do my teacher order. The response was basically: Yeah, sorry bout that. Can't help you.
Getting connected with a rep was very slow.

I was told that an item from a student order was out of stock.  However, the item still appears as in stock online and appears again in the current magazine.  The rep told me to just re-order the item, which I did, and for a second time, my order has been canceled.  The item, however, is STILL listed as available online!  The item is the Fox Lockbox.

the idea of "auto submitting" is stupid.  The rep I spoke too couldn't give me spceifics about how much time passes until an order is "auto submitted."  I give my families one week to get orders in.  It has been 4 days since the first order and it was "auto submitted." I was told if more parents order before my due date of tomorrow then I will have to call and have their orders added to avoid shipping fees--are you kidding me? So form now on this is how you are operating? I generate thousands for you each year and I will not function this way next year.  I understand that some teachers might forget, so having an order be submitted after a warning email and no response is a great idea.  THis is a huge headache and dumb.  I was going to use my $10 coupon from April and now this makes it much harder.  I WILL  NOT spend my plan time revising and adding to orders.  DUMB.
If another child that is not in your room but is on your order, the books should go with the order that is on the paper.

Autosubmit is a TERRIBLE feature. You submitted my order, before I was ready, not allowing me to take full advantage of my ordering points/promotions. After last years shipping debacle, teachers are already hesitant to come back to Scholastic. This will be the final strike for many teachers. Your staff explained the feature, but now I have to call and argue about promotions when the rest of my orders come in.  Get it together and consult some teachers before you start new features like this.
They said it was too hard to figure out via chat and that I'd need to call.

It was solved because I had another parent place an online order so I will not have the shipping fee now. However, I am still not sure why the order placed by another parent was automatically submitted without my consent. I hope that is not the future plan for Scholastic or I will not be placing orders. It affects being able to add up totals to gain incentives, bonus points, and free shipping.
Explained a change in policy BEFORE I had to call. I have none.

First off, please know that this was not the representative's fault and my displeasure has nothing to do with the chat. I started a chat to ask why two of my online student orders were submitted automatically without my knowledge. I had orders to add to the two online orders and had wanted to add some things on my own for my classroom and use up some bonus points. The order was just a few dollars away from the next level of bonus points, too. I am very frustrated with this process and not knowing it was going to happen. If I knew I would have added everything in to get the most out of the order. I was told that I could contact Scholastic once a new order is placed and combine it and get reimbursed for orders under $25 if applicable. This is a lot more work than necessary and just adds more to do from a teacher's end. The process used to be smooth and easy and now it is not. I had been a loyal customer for almost 20 years. I took a year off because after COVID it was a nightmare to order and process with Scholastic. Books took forever to come and many orders were incorrect. Some books never came and it was time consuming to rectify everything that went wrong. I missed the excitement of my students getting books, however, and several colleagues said things had gotten better, so I decided to give it try with this current class. Everything was great until this current order. Unfortunately, I will not continue to order if the automatic submissions cannot be turned off. I don't have the extra time to contact Scholastic to merge multiple orders or to get reimbursement if needed. There were many more "perks" in the past and the ease of online ordering and being able to add student and personal orders before submitting was awesome.

Scholastic for some reason now "Auto-submits" orders. I was not aware of this and my due date for my order is May 5. I have a lot of items in my teacher cart that I used with bonus points that now I will be charged shipping if I order. GET RID OF AUTO-SUBMIT.  The first agent was rude, second agent I talked to was nice. Disappointed.

Please do NOT auto submit my book order Please do not auto submit book orders.  I had set a due date for my families and then my order was auto submitted but I hadn't placed my teacher order yet.  Now I will have to call to place my order  so that I am still able to get my bonus points, classroom dollars, and free shipping.  It is very inconvenient.
I sent an email asking to add a coupon to my order that had already been submitted. The response was quick and accommodating. Thank you!!!
It was resolved because another parent ordered and I was able to add my teacher order to that.
I needed to close out my account as I am retiring this year.  It was handled quickly and verified by email.  Thank you!
