The wait time for an online chat and an actual phone call pick-up with an employee took waaaay too long.

update the Gold Apple bonus points as soon as it turns May.  I wan unable to use my $10 code for books in May (from my order in April).  I also did not like the fact that my student online orders were submitted. automatically when I wanted it to go into my May order. My may $10 coupon did not work.  Was unable to find the apple rewards bonus points bc the site was not updated to May/
The agent helped me quickly and efficiently.  I truly appreciated that!

My issue is not with the help that I received but in regards to the automatic online ordering that occurred to my account. I don't think this should have been an option.  I understand that an email was sent in regards to the matter, however, due to other circumstances, I was unable to stop the auto-ordering and now have lost out on my part of the order using my points and not having to pay shipping and the free books that I would have earned because of my student's orders.

I contacted customer service regarding the automatic submission of my student online orders. I set the due date for my class orders, and it is not until later this week. I still have student flyer orders being sent in, and scholastic already submitted my online orders, not allowing me to wait until all my orders are in so I could receive the promotions, etc. As I was talking to the man on the phone, he completely talked over me and ignored me. It was completely unprofessional, and if there is not an option to opt out of the automatic submissions I will not be ordering again.

The customer service was great.  I was not happy that my orders automatically submitted.  I wanted to look through for myself and get some more books for my class.  I also found a certificate I could have used.    But the customer service was very good.

I am saddened that you have made the most affordable books not applicable for using teacher bonus points.  I always use my accumulated points to buy each of my students a book as an end of the year gift, and this year, I cannot do that due to this change.  I cannot afford to spend $50 to buy each of my students a book, so I will not use scholastic in this way anymore.  I would have hoped you would be more understanding of teachers' needs.

I do not appreciate my order getting auto-submitted.  I was waiting on more orders and was going to do it at once.  Now I will not get the full amount of points/rewards.  I feel this was done to cheat teachers out of their rewards.

I felt like the person I chatted with started off our conversation on a rude note-- telling me that an email had already come out in regards to my question that I was concerned with I believe it said, "Per email".  It wasn't until she found that the server was down that Theresa apologized.   I did appreciate that she apologized, but I was panicking that I had missed an email or that it was my fault and was going through my email trash and inbox looking for what she emailed about.
I had a little trouble navigating from pages to the cart and back again....I am sure it is just me!

I am happy with the process however I didn't realize the address my recent order went to was not correct and someone got back to me saying that it can not be changed.  I don't believe it is shipped yet.  I would like to update my delivery address on an order. Did that is previous answer

I was disappointed that my order was placed automatically and I did not have an opportunity to add to the total so I could receive $10 in free books. I do not know what the big hurry was to submit it so quick. But you missed out on the purchase of more books and I missed out on the $10 bonus money in books. Seems like we both lose.
I started the chat with a concern about an automatic book order submission and after 10 minutes the person gave me an email address and told me to email about my issue.
I started the chat with a concern about an automatic book order submission and after 10 minutes the person gave me an email address and told me to email about my issue.
This was the easiest and quickest customer service I have had to deal with ever!  Debbie offered a solution instantly without any hesitation.  Thank you Scholastic!

I received an email stating that my online student orders had been auto-submitted. I only just sent home the fliers late last week and they are not due until May 4th. The auto-submit that happened is frustrating, as I planned to add to the order myself, I get points for the total order submitted, I have a coupon code for points, and I wanted to spend points with this last order of the school year. Now, I have lost the opportunity to increase my points based on order dollar amount, as well as the above stated issues. The representative I chatted with briefly just said this was to make it easier for teachers and I could call or email someone once the other family orders are in and I submit them, but this does not make it easier for me. I now will have take time to call, as well as have multiple shipments to track and hand out. I would recommend not auto-submitting in the future.

I won a $50 American Express e-gift card from Scholastic for participating in a survey.  Unfortunately, I am unable to use it on your website to order books for my class.  Two differnt (very nice) customer serivce reps tried to help but were unable to provide a simple solution to the problem..  If you are going to give a gift card then using it on your website should not be difficult.  Maybe you could just award people $50 credit on their Scholatic account.  Yes, I realize peope might like to use it somewhere else but at this point I am almost afraid to try it.
